Mike Pence shut the door today on a run for the presidency, but left open the likelihood that he'll seek a different office: Governor of Indiana. In the choice between seeking national office and serving Indiana in some capacity, we choose Indiana, Mike Pence , R-Columbus, said of himself and wife Karen in a letter being sent to supporters." We will not seek the Republican nomination for president in 2012." He said he would make a decision

Barack Obama - In a report prepared for Sen. Bernie Sanders , the Department of Defense disclosed that it paid$ 285 billion over a three-year span to hundreds of military contractors that defrauded the Pentagon during the same period. With the country running a$ 14 trillion national debt, my goal is to provide as much transparency as possible about what is happening with taxpayer money, said Sen. Bernie Sanders ( I-Vt.)." The sad truth is that virtually all of the major defense contractors in this country for years have been engaged in systemic fraudulent behavior, while receiving hundreds of billions of dollars

the command of George H.W. Bush 's son, President Bush . Another view on war's end The journal Foreign Policy also questions whether the war truly was successful. Memories of Desert Storm In ending the war unilaterally before Saddam Hussein had been chastened, the George H.W. Bush administration condemned the United States to a long-term presence in the Gulf in an effort to contain Iraq. This presence, and the sanctions imposed on Iraq due to Saddam Hussein 's recalcitrance, in the end served as a rallying cry for jihadists such as Osama Bin Laden against the United States and its friends in the region. Colin Powell , chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff under the first George H.W. Bush and secretary of state under the second, was among officials gathered with the elder George H.W. Bush at a symposium last week to discuss the war
